PrivacyPage.title: Privacy Policy
PrivacyPage.subtitle: Your privacy is important to us

overview.title: Privacy Overview
overview.description: FlashyLearny is designed with privacy at its core. All your study data stays on your device. We don't collect, store, or transmit any of your personal information or study content to external servers.

storedLocally.title: Data Stored Locally
items: Your flashcard decks and their content
Study progress and statistics
App preferences (theme, settings)
Session data for study tracking
storedLocally.note: Important: This data never leaves your device and is stored in your browser's local database.

notCollected.title: Data We DON'T Collect
items: Personal information (name, email, phone)
Usage analytics or tracking data
Device information or IP addresses
Study content or progress data
Cookies for tracking purposes

localStorage.title: Local Storage
localStorage.description: All data is stored using IndexedDB in your browser. This is a client-side database that keeps your information secure and accessible offline.

security.title: üîê Security
security.description: Your data is protected by your browser's security measures and is not accessible to other websites or applications.

deviceAccess.title: Device Access
deviceAccess.description: Only you have access to your study data through this app on your device. No accounts or sign-ups are required.

dataBackup.title: Data Backup
dataBackup.description: You can export your data as CSV files for backup purposes. These files remain under your control.

hosting.title: Hosting
hosting.description: This application is hosted on Vercel. While Vercel may collect standard web server logs (IP addresses, request times), they do not have access to your study data since it's stored locally.

noAnalytics.title: No Analytics
noAnalytics.description: We do not use Google Analytics, Facebook Pixel, or any other tracking services. Your usage patterns and study habits remain private.

dataControl.title: Data Control
items: Access: All your data is always accessible through the app
Export: Download your data as CSV files anytime
Delete: Clear all data through browser settings
Modify: Edit or delete individual cards and decks

dataPortability.title: Data Portability
items: Export decks to CSV format
Import data from other flashcard apps
No vendor lock-in or proprietary formats
Standard, readable file formats

dataDeletion.title: Data Deletion
dataDeletion.description: Since all data is stored locally on your device, you have complete control over its deletion:

howToDelete.title: How to delete your data:
steps: Clear your browser's storage for this site
Use your browser's "Clear browsing data" feature
Uninstall the PWA from your device
Delete individual decks and cards within the app

contact.title: Questions or Concerns?
contact.description: If you have any questions about this privacy policy or how FlashyLearny handles your data, you can reach out through:
contact.updateNote: This privacy policy may be updated from time to time. Any changes will be posted on this page.

HelpPage.title: Help & Support
HelpPage.subtitle: Get the most out of FlashyLearny with these helpful guides

step1.title: 1. Create Your First Deck
step1.description: Start by creating a deck to organize your study material. Click the "Create Deck" button on the decks page and give it a descriptive name.

step2.title: 2. Add Cards
step2.description: Click "Add Card" to create flashcards. Write a clear question on the front and the answer on the back. Keep them concise for better memorization.

step3.title: 3. Start Studying
step3.description: Use the "Start Studying" button to begin a study session. Review each card and honestly mark whether you knew the answer.

bestPractices.title: Best Practices
items: Study in short, regular sessions (15-30 minutes)
Be honest when marking cards as known/unknown
Review difficult cards more frequently
Create cards in your own words
Focus on understanding, not just memorization

thingsToAvoid.title: Things to Avoid
items: Making cards too long or complex
Studying when tired or distracted
Marking cards as known when you're not sure
Skipping review sessions
Creating too many new cards at once

spacedRepetition.title: Spaced Repetition
spacedRepetition.description: Cards you struggle with will appear more frequently, while cards you've mastered will appear less often. This helps optimize your study time and improves long-term retention.

progressTracking.title: Progress Tracking
progressTracking.description: Monitor your learning progress with detailed statistics. See how many cards you've mastered, are currently learning, or haven't studied yet.

offlineMode.title: Offline Mode
offlineMode.description: All your data is stored locally on your device. You can study anywhere, even without an internet connection. Your progress syncs automatically when you reconnect.

dataDisappeared.title: My data disappeared or cards aren't loading
dataDisappeared.description: This usually happens when browser data is cleared. Try:
steps: Check if you're using a different browser or incognito mode
Import your data from a CSV backup if available

appWontInstall.title: The app won't install on my device
steps: Use a supported browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)
Look for the install button in your browser's address bar
On mobile, use "Add to Home Screen" from the browser menu

studySessionsNotWorking.title: Study sessions aren't working properly
steps: Make sure your deck has cards
Refresh the page and try again
Check console for any error messages
